intro: Scrophularia stiefelhagenii, commonly known as the Stiefelhagen scrophularia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
